description: A short lesson to help you apply Classifiers: Sign Language's Visual Superpower.

hook.text: Sign languages can show a car swerving around a pedestrian in a single fluid movement. Try that in English.

buildup.text: Classifiers are handshapes that represent categories of objects â€” vehicles, people, flat surfaces.

discovery.text: A signer can simultaneously show two objects and their spatial relationship â€” in real time.

twist.text: Expressing 'the cat jumped over the fence' takes English six words and ASL one elegant movement.

climax.text: Classifiers give sign languages expressive power that spoken languages simply cannot match.

punchline.text: Some ideas are better expressed in three dimensions than in a line of words.

quiz.question: What are classifiers in sign language?
options: Handshapes representing categories of objects and their movement
